titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn letterhead collection BCMS.0008
titlestmt.author: Brooklyn Collection staff and finding aid revised and updated by Diana Bowers-Smith

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2026-01-12 14:48:01 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

change.item: Revised and updated by Dee Bowers

did.abstract: The Brooklyn letterhead collection spans 200 years of business in Brooklyn. Several thousand different businesses, institutions, and organizations are represented in the collection, including carpenters, plumbers, painters, city agencies, religious institutions, and more.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection is a compendium of smaller collections and individual items from various sources and will continue to grow.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The items are arranged alphabetically by business name. Multiple items from the same business are arranged chronologically.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: This collection has been completely digitized, but is not yet available online. Consult CBH staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item/descriptive title, date (if known); Brooklyn letterhead collection, BCMS.0008; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Checks and receipts from Brooklyn businesses and institutions collection (CBHM.0014)
Brooklyn and New York City business catalogs collection (1986.047)

Brooklyn Newsstand: Our digital and keyword-searchable database of over 40 local Brooklyn newspapers includes advertisements for, articles mentioning, and sometimes even images of the businesses in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Brooklyn letterhead collection spans 200 years of business in Brooklyn. Several thousand different businesses, institutions, and organizations are represented in the collection, including carpenters, plumbers, painters, city agencies, religious institutions, and more. The complete listing of the names, addresses, and dates from the letterhead collection could be used by genealogical researchers, those interested in the history of various industries in Brooklyn, neighborhood historians and many others. Many of the letterheads are visually interesting as well, with elaborate typefaces, intricate imagery, and archaic handwriting.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The borrower assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
